contextId.information: Wormwood is a plant that gives a liquid which is very bitter to drink. "Wormwood" and "bitterness" have similar meanings and emphasize that this is something that is very bitter. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The words "filthy scum" and "refuse" both refer to things that people have rejected and thrown away. AT: "You have thrown us away as if we were just trash." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: You have made us like filthy scum and refuse

contextId.information: These two words share similar meanings and refer to destruction of Jerusalem. AT: "total destruction." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two words mean basically the same thing and emphasize that these are people who desired to harm Jerusalem. AT: "any kind of enemy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

These two words mean basically the same thing and emphasize the intensity of gladness. The writer uses these words sarcastically. AT: "Be very glad." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])
